snippet: Dozens of organizations that provide social services in New York and the surrounding area are undertaking rebranding efforts to freshen their appeal and ensure that the public knows what they do.
abstract: Dozens of nonprofit groups in New York City and surrounding metropolitan area are trying to find new names and rebrand themselves in order to better reflect their missions; LiveOn NY is example of one of those groups, as it shed its previous name Council of Senior Centers and Services of New York City Inc, which it has had since its founding, in July.
lead_paragraph: Dozens of organizations that provide social services in New York and the surrounding area are undertaking rebranding efforts to freshen their appeal and ensure that the public knows what they do.

headline.main: Nonprofits, Aiming for Relevance, Try On New Names
headline.print_headline: Nonprofits Seek a Name to Reflect Their Mission
